Today, I submitted my thesis! These three Wordle attempts summarise the three topics of my PhD research: 

  1) designing diagnostic plots for projection pursuit optimisation, applied to guided **tour**, 
  2) developing a spatio-temporal data structure in R and using **glyph** maps to visualise the data, and 
  3) proposing a data pipeline approach under the tidy framework to construct **indexes**.

Surprisingly (and hopefully), the last two words turned out to be actual  Wordle solutions: "glyph‚Äù on 18th November 2022, and ‚Äúindex‚Äù on 15th August 2023 - just a few days before the submission deadline! Realising today's Wordle solution is what I've been working on daily feels like stumbling upon the crossword clue ‚Äúcorolla leaf" üå∏, or in a more recent analogy, spotting the Ad√©lie penguins in the Sea Life üêß. 

To see what I have been working on for the past 3.5 years, you can check out my thesis at <https://sherryzhang-thesis.netlify.app/>
